hook.text: A desert oasis became one of the richest cities in the Roman world. Its queen challenged Rome and nearly won.

buildup.text: Palmyra sat at the crossroads of Silk Road trade in modern Syria. It grew fabulously wealthy from tolls and trade.

discovery.text: Queen Zenobia conquered Egypt and much of the Roman East in 270 AD before Rome struck back.

twist.text: In 2015, ISIS dynamited Palmyra's 2,000-year-old Temple of Bel. The world watched the destruction live.

climax.text: Archaeologists used crowdsourced tourist photos to build 3D models and plan reconstruction of the ruins.

punchline.text: Tourist selfies may help rebuild a city destroyed by war.

quiz.question: Who was Zenobia?
options: A queen of Palmyra who challenged Rome
